snippet: Scott M. Stringer, the Manhattan borough president, plans to recommend that a proposal to build above Chelsea Market be vetoed unless it is significantly scaled back.
abstract: Manhattan Borough President Scott M Stringer questions a much-debated proposal from Jamestown Properties to build hotel and office space above Chelsea Market, saying he plans to recommend the project be vetoed unless it is significantly scaled back; Stringer, who is a likely mayoral candidate, expresses concern that the height and bulk of the proposed structures would not fit in with the historic neighborhood.
lead_paragraph: Scott M. Stringer, the Manhattan borough president, plans to recommend that a proposal to build above Chelsea Market be vetoed unless it is significantly scaled back.

headline.seo: Plan to Build Atop Chelsea Market Hits Resistance From Stringer
headline.main: Borough President Questions Chelsea Market Plan
headline.print_headline: Borough President Questions Chelsea Market Plan
